description: Smallest number that is sum of 2 positive n-th powers in 2 different ways.
references: R. Alter, Computations and generalizations on a remark of Ramanujan, pp. 182-196 of "Analytic Number Theory (Philadelphia, 1980)", ed. M. I. Knopp, Lect. Notes Math., Vol. 899, 1981.
formula: a(n) <= A230561(n) for n > 1, with equality at least for n = 2, and inequality at least for n = 3. - _Jonathan Sondow_, Oct 24 2013
mathematica: (* This is just an empirical verification *) Do[max = 4 + n^4; Clear[cnt]; cnt[_] = 0; smallest = Infinity;  Do[ cnt[an = x^n + y^n] += 1; If[cnt[an] == 2 && an < smallest, smallest = an], {x, 1, max}, {y, x, max}]; Print["a(", n, ") = ", smallest], {n, 1, 4}] (* _Jean-FranÃ§ois Alcover_, Aug 13 2013 *)
author: _Robert G. Wilson v_, Dec 11 1999
